message.content:
cs.CR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.HC, cs.IR 

The paper focuses on technical support scams, which are a type of cybercrime that involves social engineering tactics to convince users to provide remote access to their machines. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) and cybercrime (cs.CY). The paper also discusses the use of malvertising to expose users to these scams, which relates to the sub-category of social media (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper includes a controlled experiment to study the social engineering tactics used by scammers, which falls under the sub-categories of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and information retrieval (cs.IR).
